data.event: Washington County is Arkansas's 17th county, formed on October 17, 1828, and named for George Washington, the first President of the United States.

event.title: known as Lovely County, and one year later

data.event: The area was next known as Lovely County, and one year later Washington County was created after another Cherokee treaty.

event.title: were both founded in Washington County within a day

data.event: Arkansas College and Cane Hill College were both founded in Washington County within a day of each other in 1834, with the University of Arkansas being founded in Fayetteville in 1871.

event.title: was established through the county in 1858

data.event: A Butterfield Overland Mail route was established through the county in 1858, causing more families to settle there.
